title: Bilanzbuchhalter w/m
body:
Qualified Accountant (Bilanzbuchhalter)

The Accountant is responsible for the financial accounting tasks in Austria, to be based in our office in Vienna, and the consolidation of the financial accounts of a further permanent establishment abroad. The position addresses tight deadlines and a multitude of accounting activities including general ledger preparation, financial reporting, year-end audit preparation and the support of budget and forecast activities.


What you'll be doing:

  • Compliance with federal, state, and local financial legal requirements by studying existing and new legislation, enforcing adherence to requirements, and advising on needed actions
  • Financial accounting, reconciliation and month end closing
  • Cost accounting, register, scan and code invoices for approval, including reimbursed expenses, credit cards etc. Including reconciliations of vendors
  • VAT reconciliation and tax-return in accordance with local tax legislation
  • Reporting to authorities, e.g. export figures and contractors
  • Reconciliation of financial discrepancies by collecting and analysing account information
  • Maintenance of financial security by following internal controls
  • Preparation of payments by verifying documentation and requesting disbursements, bank reconciliations etc.
  • IFRS Quarterly Reporting for NLS Austria, consolidating information for NLS Catalonia (permanent establishment)
  • Cashflow forecasting
  • Any other projects as defined by CFO
Your qualifications and experience:

  • Qualified accountant (Bilanzbuchhalter)
  • NAV experience not essential
  • Tech savvy, open for new ideas and quick to adapt
  • Critical and progressive thinker
  • Very good English speaker
  • Team player
  • Excellent working environment in a committed and international team of experts



What's in it for you:

  • On-going training and certification initiatives
  • Exciting career opportunities in a quickly growing industry leading company based in a central location in Vienna
  • Travelling opportunities
  • An annual gross salary starting at â‚¬ 40.000 and willingness to offer a higher salary depending on your specific professional experience and qualifications
  • Flexible working hours, lunch vouchers and an excellent canteen
  • Excellent working environment in a committed and international team of experts

We look forward to getting to know you.
